means: 使某人不再抱幻想或不再受骗，使（某人）醒悟( undeceive的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His behaviour soon undeceived her as to his true intentions.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的行为很快就使她明白了他的真实意图.

sentence.Network_en: Indeed, they sometimes dive below as it were by mistake, and are undeceived.
sentence.Network_cn: 是的, 有时它们氽水到水平线之下,好像这是偶然的错误, 继而恍然大悟.

list.exp: 以让这个美好的爱情觉醒
list.abs: “For All Time”的蓝本在1982年的《Thriller》时期就已经创作出来了, 只是... For this good love undeceiving 以让这个美好的爱情觉醒 I'll go anywhere.
One warm kiss in this cold night air在夜晚的冷风中献上一个温暖的亲吻 For this good love undeceiving以让这个美好的爱情觉醒 I'll go anywhere我会去到.

means.word_mean: 1. freed of a mistaken or misguided notion;

sentences.sentence: "some people are still not disabused of the old idea that the universe revolves around the Earth"
